claim: Buddy Holly was a musician and a singer-songwriter in a band.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Holley was born in Lubbock , Texas , to a musical family during the Great Depression ; he learned to play guitar and to sing alongside his siblings .

claim: Buddy Holly was a musician and a singer-songwriter in a band.

claim: Buddy Holly was a musician and a singer-songwriter in a band.

claim: Buddy Holly was a musician and a singer-songwriter in a band.
premise_source_doc_sentence: In 1955 , after opening for Elvis Presley , Holly decided to pursue a career in music .

claim: Buddy Holly was a musician and a singer-songwriter in a band.
premise_source_doc_sentence: He opened for Presley three times that year ; his band 's style shifted from country and western to entirely rock and roll .

claim: Buddy Holly was a musician and a singer-songwriter in a band.
premise_source_doc_sentence: In October that year , when he opened for Bill Haley & His Comets , Holly was spotted by Nashville scout Eddie Crandall , who helped him get a contract with Decca Records .

claim: Buddy Holly was a musician and a singer-songwriter in a band.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Holly 's recording sessions at Decca were produced by Owen Bradley .

claim: Buddy Holly was a musician and a singer-songwriter in a band.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Unhappy with Bradley 's control in the studio and with the sound he achieved there , Holly went to producer Norman Petty in Clovis , New Mexico , and recorded a demo of `` That 'll Be the Day '' , among other songs .

claim: Buddy Holly was a musician and a singer-songwriter in a band.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Petty became the band 's manager and sent the demo to Brunswick Records , which released it as a single credited to `` The Crickets '' , which became the name of Holly 's band .

claim: Buddy Holly was a musician and a singer-songwriter in a band.

claim: Buddy Holly was a musician and a singer-songwriter in a band.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Its success was followed in October by another major hit , `` Peggy Sue '' .

claim: Buddy Holly was a musician and a singer-songwriter in a band.
premise_source_doc_sentence: The album Chirping Crickets , released in November 1957 , reached number five on the UK Albums Chart .

claim: Buddy Holly was a musician and a singer-songwriter in a band.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Holly made his second appearance on The Ed Sullivan Show in January 1958 and soon after , toured Australia and then the UK .

claim: Buddy Holly was a musician and a singer-songwriter in a band.

claim: Buddy Holly was a musician and a singer-songwriter in a band.
premise_source_doc_sentence: After a show in Clear Lake , Iowa , Holly chartered an airplane to travel to his next show , in Moorhead , Minnesota .

claim: Buddy Holly was a musician and a singer-songwriter in a band.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Soon after takeoff , the plane crashed , killing Holly , Ritchie Valens , The Big Bopper , and pilot Roger Peterson in a tragedy later referred to by Don McLean as `` The Day the Music Died '' .
